text: we ordered two omelettes and two lemonades.
delicious breakfasts, scrambled eggs, omelettes, pancakes, toasts, the choice is wide and everyone will like something
we took a baguette and an omelette with paprika, all seasoned well.. a great selection of mini salad dressing, served with an omelette.
always a good spot for some delightful breakfast, despite the fact at the time of my visit they were out of potatoes they still made a great omelette and toast!
my omelette and grits were better than expected.
the cheesecakes were quite good and the omelette very tasty.
sorry but i don't want french fries with my omelette.

after half an hour we ask where our order is, the waitress that it will be in 10 minutes, then after 15 minutes we ask again and that they are "already putting on" ... frustrated after another 5 minutes we get up and say that we are leaving, the waitress brings food suddenly (already not the one who served us originally, the other one has already started avoiding us), only an omelette was served, the second course was served after another 5 minutes ... we ate quickly and paid equally quickly and left.
food was cooked well,but,i could not pronounce the omelette dish i ordered.. ordinary american or western omelettes were not available.
we didn't eat the omelette to the end and we ended up visiting ... it's a pity but i won't use it anymore
when the order finally came (omelette with soinach) it was just watery with low quality, cheapest tesco bread you can imagine.

failure ... a long waiting period, 45 minutes for breakfast (fried eggs and an omelette is a bit of a lot) plus winter coffee, because the waitress forgot to bring ... dinner supposedly ok, but portions are small compared to the price and vegetables are undercooked, the service is messy and not very nice, i do not recommend it
Nice service, however, my omelette was a little bit dry.
Slightly dry toast, omelette could be better seasoned.
The omelette was dry and the sweet stuff was overpoweringly sweet.
the pizza was drier than stale bread.
horrible dry pizza, i do not recommend it.
perfect pizza if you like to go to the toilet every now and then
pierogi ok, pizza very weak, pasta very greasy, sea fruit, unfortunately the worst, calamari, shrimps, fish not to eat (fries from seafood).
we ordered two pizzas.
very pleasant atmosphere, great location, but the taste of the pizza is very average, and a punctuation error on the card encouraging you to leave your opinion.
average pizza, a bit burnt, the waiting time was supposed to be 20 minutes and it was 45. the staff did not even know if i had settled the payment.

pizza ok. the nagner did not give a quiet read menu, we entered because they had a blanket and fire and in january evening a big + after we entered the waiter-nagner disappeared when i went inside to place the order because there was no waiter, 3-4 tables were occupied after ordering beer and pizza we've been waiting for pizza almost 40 minutes ...
however, the pizza didn't knock me down.. pizza should be an asset to return or enter their next place.
you can order pizza (but it's not a super thin crust), pasta (good but not amazing), gyros, soups, coffee and desserts.
good pizza and nice service.
tasty pizza, very light, minus too little space, minus a very long waiting time for an order.
pizza is good to try
tasty pizza, good ingredients, plus dough.
very good pizza, pleasant atmosphere
the herring starter was too salty, the salad had mayonnaise as the only sauce.
carrots, sweet salad, sweet ukrainian borscht.
chicken salad is a failure.

i have always appreciated aioli, a very nice place with a kitchen that suits my taste, but after the last visit i was a bit disappointed when it comes to prices ... basic burger 37 zlotys, caesar salad with chicken 42 zlotys, freshly squeezed juice ... diluted with water, pilsner beer 17 zlotys.. as long as the price of the burger can be forgiven, because it was tasty and with additives, the price of the salad is a cosmos, a few leaves of lettuce and not all 100g of chicken for pln 42.
i'm sorry, but i have to admit it was the worst caesar salad i have ever eaten.
food tasty, one suggestion for a children's dish, i would not give a salad with hot sauce, but for example, delicious baked vegetables that my husband received for his tenderloin.
medium fresh salads, all mixed together so it was hard to tell them apart.
nice to start the restaurant with goma wakame seaweed salad.

i don't know what's going on but it's always been very good recently some totoala lime burger for pln 50 very poor and the meat of madness did not do shrimp salad pln 45 lettuce and vegetables for a shrimp medicine 5 medium-sized lemonade for pln 16 water with with lemon concentrate and ice, i don't know what's going on but we left surprised
the apple salad was okay (3/5) but the rabbit dumplings were not very good.
the shrimp burger and smoked chicken salad are highly recommended.
the spaghetti tagliatelle with truffles and the caesar salad turned out to be delicious.
first class food, mmmm salad, heaven in mouth chicken ðŸ¤©ðŸ¥° very nice service.
delicious, melt-in-your-mouth panko coated cod, crunchy sweet potato fries, fresh coleslaw salad and tartar sauce.
shakshuka and salad phenomenal.
food has always been very mediocre here but the chicken pad thai was plain.
pad thai with salty tofu, as if covered with vinegar.
extremely greasy ramen soup which gave me food poisoning, and the worst tasting pad thai weâ€™ve ever had, sloppily presented with very few fresh ingredients.
pad thai was total disaster, the smell, the taste, also the most ugly dish i've ever had.
in pad thai with prawns and squid, i found two prawns and three pieces of squid.

to sum up, if you choose a dish, i recommend shrimps instead of meat because at least the prawns that were in the starter were great (our dishes are pad thai with chicken and stir fry noodles with beef) and of course to justify the main dishes were of a weak, uniform taste, of course beautifully presented but it did not defend itself
pad thai tasty, good taste, although i ate better.. the most expensive pad thai, which i ate in poland
pad thai with pork is probably unique
i went for the supposedly "best vegan pad thai" as it turned out later, maybe it would be good, but the amount of oil exceeded its taste.
long waiting time, as it turned out later, was a very average pad thai.
i recommend pad thai
carbonara is very good, pad thai is spicy in my opinion.
i will risk saying that here is the best pad thai in gdaÅ„sk.
food delicious, beef ramen and chicken pad thai were great!
the best pad thai in the tri-city
raw chicken that you give to the child.. too cold fries and raw chicken.
bad service (nothing friendly, fun and hrc exciting); appetizers came after 30min - hair on the chicken wings; main dishes after over 1 hourâ€¦ another hit on the stakeâ€¦.

fewer employees (long waiting time for the waiter, drinks served almost at the same time as the food), poorer quality of ingredients (maybe only i came across such an "ugly" piece of chicken in a burger?)
chicken grilled a few days ago and cruelly salty.
old and seasoned chicken.
we ordered fish and panko chicken.
massacre, a portion for a child, i left that hungry for two pieces of chicken in pasta.

i have always appreciated aioli, a very nice place with a kitchen that suits my taste, but after the last visit i was a bit disappointed when it comes to prices ... basic burger 37 zlotys, caesar salad with chicken 42 zlotys, freshly squeezed juice ... diluted with water, pilsner beer 17 zlotys.. as long as the price of the burger can be forgiven, because it was tasty and with additives, the price of the salad is a cosmos, a few leaves of lettuce and not all 100g of chicken for pln 42.
chicken tomato paste ðŸ…, just a little ðŸ…, zero ðŸ” !
a big disadvantage, if the menu with meat is only chicken breast and veal brisket, it is unacceptable that one of these dishes is missing, and so it happened that the brisket is missing.
very tasty chicken livers with fried onion, apple and raspberriesðŸ¤—.
first class food, mmmm salad, heaven in mouth chicken ðŸ¤©ðŸ¥° very nice service.
large portions, chicken breast with spinach - insane;) nice service.
everything on the menu is the same - supreme chicken, burgers and steaksâ€¦.
delicious liver and chicken, a revelation fish soup.
pulled pork in one piece.
today i tried pulled pork.
my partnerâ€™s pulled pork was dry and heavily sauced seemingly to cover up how dry it was, and my fish and chips were so bland.
bao rolls with pulled pork - very weak: the meat is cold, the rolls are usually steamed cooked.
unfortunately, the take-out pulled pork burger was far from perfect or even decent.
an atmospheric place, well-kept place, friendly service, but still pulled pork does not "appeal" to my burger, although the burger is good.
we used pulled pork rolls.
i chose those with chicken and pulled pork.
the kids are delighted, and what is more important, children's dishes with vegetables ... with minuses is a slightly pulled pork loin ... but we will come back anyway.
big reservations about pulled pork fries.. by the words pulled pork we associate rather "disintegrated" juicy meat.
we chose shrimp and pulled pork burgers as main courses.
pulled pork was my favorite though.
pulled pork sandwich, served with marinated vegetables and barbecue sauce - one of the best dishes i've ever had.
delicious food, in the pictures duck buns, kimchi pulled pork and pulled pork.
beautiful place, friendly service, we especially recommend mango curry bowl, kimchi pulled pork and hottie.
i must say that i was unfortunately disappointed with the taste of the soups and curry stews, they were very vague.
the worst red curry i've ever eaten.
green curry is a box full of oil.....really unhealthy and bad....
the food was not good (pad thai and shrimp curry).. there was not a single shrimp in the shrimp curry.
we ordered a chicken curry with soy noodles and a thai soup with a friend.
green chicken curry also nice, rich in additives.
the rest did it - spring rolls, curry chicken, ribs ok. not outstanding, but tasty.
unfortunately, the green curry chicken i received is far from what i have always ordered.
curry and mango curry without any frenzy, more home-made than asian.
the yellow curry was also polonized, but tasty nonetheless, and it was 3 stars.. as for the prices of 2x pho soup and 2x curry, it was around pln 120.
i loved both the curry, and the ramen.
the mango curry bowl was delicious, velvety, aromatic, slightly spicy and slightly sweet at the same time.

this place is at a great location the staff here are very nice and friendly.i am vegan so you have  food for everyone.i had the tofu bao set and my wife had the mango curry.plus we ordered for drinks and sweet potato fries.all of it was very good.the place has good atmosphere and they are very quick with the food.overall i would highly recommend this place.
mango-curry flavor - perfectly balanced.
beautiful place, friendly service, we especially recommend mango curry bowl, kimchi pulled pork and hottie.
a very small portion, for example: 3 potato pancakes: o ... additionally, dripping with fat ... service is a big plus, but the service automatically added to the receipt spoils everything.
the potato pancakes were very greasy of the pork tenderloin that was as good for a cat as it was and was generally bland.

yesterday i ate the main dish of the day, broth, which i have no objection to because it was tasty, but for the main course i took dumplings and potato pancakes that could not be eaten not only that they were burnt, they had to be fried in a very large amount of lard.
potato pancakes are made from potato flour, not real potatoes.
the second course - salted, flour potato pancakes, chicken breast coating in old fat.
there were only 3 potato pancakes.

on the other hand, i ordered potato pancakes with salmon and - i should take into account that there will be a lot of dill in polish, potato cuisine, but i have the impression that it spilled twice too much :) nevertheless, my fault is that i did not ask for a dish without dill which i do not like .. however, at the moment when i tried the potato pancakes and a hair came out of them, the rating dropped drastically by 2 eyes.
good compote, potato pancakes, etc.
the only plus was the food, the potato pancakes were tasty.
other toppings like potato pancakes and salad were ok.

the potato pancake with smoked trout was absolutely masterful - i consider myself a master of potato pancakes and this one tasted as good as mine ðŸ˜‹ the octopus for the main course was also perfectly cooked, and the celery ice cream for dessert surprised us with its unobvious taste.

potatoes are served in various variants: potato pancakes, casseroles, or in uniforms, and a choice of various meat or vegetable sauces.. a very big plus for the waiting time: i ordered my dish and in 10 minutes i had delicious, crispy and golden potato pancakes.
food lumpy, potato pancakes very good, dumplings sticking together badly, so there was a lot of water inside.
the potato pancakes were tasty, the git casserole, you can fill up.
very tasty potato pancakes.
at first half of the dishes on the menu are not available, then wait 45 minutes for food and then get a disgusting and cold lasagne.
laughable lasagne, do you serve the same on site, or just for takeaway?
we are with a partner, a fan of italian cuisine, and this creation in the photo called lasagne bolognese next to bolognese did not even stand.
lasagne was microwaved.
we had margarita pizza and lasagne, which is supposed to be their speciality.
the linguine with clams, lasagne, veal & eggplant parmagianas were nowhere near the quality it used to be.
the pizza is good, but the spinnaker lasagne is not recommended.
my advice: if an adult takes lasagne bolonese for himself, i suggest ordering a double portion right away.
lasagne perfectly ok but take something else.
thin crust pizza, lasagne - i haven't eaten that for a long time.
very delicious lasagne, great service!
lasagne fingers lick, friendly service, large portions
wife's best lasagne ever she said.
pancake lasagne is a blast!
we ate lasagne and carbonare, something lovely!
my husband ordered black fish risotto - it was a complete failure.
i was expecting something better ..... starter of fish poached in oil, and seafood risotto overcooked and without the taste of the sea.
salmon ok, but the risotto underneath it left a lot to be desired.
risotto with peas, tomato and leek served with salmon in march, very weak.
the risotto was more like cheese rice and had so much parmesean (a very salty cheese) that we really couldn't eat more than a few bites.
hungarian pancake unpalatable for me, risotto terribly dry frozen vegetables.
i ordered their fabulous risotto and immediately i notice that it looked different.
risotto with vegetables and chicken dry and reheated several times, medium food.

the service was nice and professional, the dishes were presented well, but what if after eating tapas with seafood, risotto for two and desserts, the visit ended with acute food poisoning, which is unacceptable in such a place !!!
good food, but not cauliflower risotto.
we were not disappointed either, because the cauliflower risotto and the mutton burger were very delicious and nicely served.
great atmosphere, perfect service of mrs. magdalena, and the food is delicious, burgers, soup, risotto, everything buttoned up to the last button.
the seafood risotto brought you to your knees.
big wow for the tartare and the tuna one and the deer one ... the seafood risotto is a masterpiece.
the burrata was delicious and so was the risotto.
i was not able to eat my dish, but the boyfriend ate his steak because he did not eat all day, even though it was impossible to even cut it and if it were not for the tasty sauce, eat it.
a steak for pln 99 looks like from a roadside bar.
the 110 pln steak was tasteless as was the sauce.
steaks are nothing but fat, just terrible

steak was served rare which our group did not like- we weren't asked about temperature prior to being served and nobody checked on us during our meal to make sure everything came out okay so we couldn't even ask for it to be cooked more.
the steaks are gone .. the fish .. today we just left the restaurant after a few minutes of studying the menu.
the steak toppings are great.
a friend's steak was fine, but the baked potato was tasteless to him.
squid steak was nicely cooked, too many onions and looked like cuttlefish.. steak tartare was okay, beef salad too sweet.
the osage menu is a basic steak house menu and the wait staff is attired like they work at luby's but you will still pay like you are at a high end restaurant.
everything on the menu is the same - supreme chicken, burgers and steaksâ€¦.
we ordered beef serloin steak.
the steak melted in my mouth.
a very climatic place, good dishes (delicious pasta and steaks), prices - know, quite high but you pay for prestige.
great steak
i ordered a kebab without olives, i got olives .... for this price you really expected something specific, not a cake wrapped in tortillas and fries with meat.
meat and tortilla were cold two identical kebabs in one, fries were in the other, unfortunately not.
after a long wait i got a dry kebab with no sauce in a burnt tortilla.
taco was had a terrible tortilla, however the patio has a great location.
i have practically not found the meat in the tortilla.. the tortillas were poorly folded and falling apart.
i ordered a whole wheat tortilla and i got it usually.
my daughterâ€™s quesadillas came with a side of tortilla chips so i enjoyed those with the queso.
none of the dishes were amazing and they gave a lot of unnecessary tortilla chips between courses.
through delicious.pl i ordered feta tortilla with additional meat.. there was no sign of feta or any sauce in the tortilla.
i take 2 stars for the price - over pln 50 for 2 medium-sized tortillas is definitely too much.
the homemade tortillas are delicious though, but the place seems to be popping mostly because of its location and big terrasse, especially during sunny days.

we were especially enamored of the appetizers in the lounge = oyster, chicharrÃ³n, tortilla soup, and tiny empanada , the venison carpaccio so full of flavor, the extra course of crispy duck (so good!)
check out the pecan pie, and those hand made tortillas!
impossibly delicious peanut cream and great tortilla.
tortilla with "kebab" delicious but a hit was the eggplant dish.
fish soup very weak and tiny, and it cost pln 25: /
my husband ordered black fish risotto - it was a complete failure.
fish & chips dry and hard, blue tartare, dirty in the bathroom, cables sticking out of the walls.
overpriced soggy fish and cold fries!
after the first bite we thanked, the fish (tuna) was spoiled and simply smelled.
the steaks are gone .. the fish .. today we just left the restaurant after a few minutes of studying the menu.
it was much worse with the second courses ... the fish soup turned out to be rather vegetable, and the carbonara pasta was floating in the sauce and it was easier to eat with a spoon.

we ordered fish and panko chicken.. it is worth asking about the fish, because all the items on the menu turned out to be frozen.. and my fish landed on the next table ... then it came back to the kitchen ...... and then back to me ..... as my plate wandered, the fish wasn't hot anymore .... the waiter only at the end of our meal asked if everything was ok .....
i think steaks can be good, but for fish and chips it is 3 plus.
fish is okay, prices are also affordable.
delicious dumplings, great fish in excellent breadcrumbs, friendly service, only pluses, no minuses
i have never eaten such a good fish!. fish soup also very tasty, well seasoned.
very good fish and other dishes, affordable prices and adequate for the quality and location
we wanted something a bit more homely, with fresh fish on offer and a relaxed atmosphere.
the fish is very good, the soup even more so, generous portions at a moderate price.
pancakes burnt on the bottom in a way that indicates heating, not fresh preparation.

tasty tripe but as for the main course, it is a pity that i ordered them, i had pork tenderloin with blanched vegetables, they were cauliflower, carrots and broccoli, it is a pity that at this time of the year the cook uses frozen vegetables, on top of that they were overcooked summer and tasteless and the pancakes were also, unfortunately, frozen and extra soaked fry
3 stars for weak pancakes zero crunchiness from a lot of fat i know it's a fast food bar but you can try better.
terrible pancakes, without expression, only the jam saved them.
we ordered typically breakfast food french toast and my daughter had pancakes.. my daughter pancakes were cold.
before we could order breakfast, our children were already very hungry, so we took out their milk bottles and banana pancakes that we had with us.
there were only 3 potato pancakes.
we came very hungry and left full, without ordering pancakes which we also wanted.
food presented very nice, i highly recommend the nachos... are waiter chris aka fred was outstanding... well worth the visit... will be returning for pancakes...
good compote, potato pancakes, etc.. the pancakes could be baked on the fly, sometimes they are fried.
we went for breakfasts (full english, beef bagel, pancakes).

the potato pancake with smoked trout was absolutely masterful - i consider myself a master of potato pancakes and this one tasted as good as mine ðŸ˜‹ the octopus for the main course was also perfectly cooked, and the celery ice cream for dessert surprised us with its unobvious taste.
food presented very nice, i highly recommend the nachos... are waiter chris aka fred was outstanding... well worth the visit... will be returning for pancakes...
then the main course: tenderloin in chanterelle sauce on potato pancakes - a fairy tale!. everything freshly made, golden pancakes, soft and juicy meat.
pancakes with cottage cheese and fruit - delicious, pork chop with potatoes and salad, great location, affordable prices.
had to send back my wife's ravioli and broccolini because it was cold.
risotto was a bit too greasy/salty and not the right consistency for our taste, the ravioli was bland.
the ravioli was very lukewarm and watery.
The son ordered ravioli with saffron sauce and another one with tomato sauce.
meat ravioli with tomato sauce was meh.
i was interested in an off-the-menu dish, but i forgot to ask about the price and i paid 70 zlotys for a piece of meat and three ravioli.
i expected better ravioli, and the dumplings did not surprise me with anything special.
ravioli average, coffee was horrible

both of our mains (the ravioli and the steak ) were very average and underwhelming.. i could get over that if the quality was above par, but i've seriously made store bought ravioli and pasta sauce that tasted better.
fish was overcooked and ravioli lackluster.
different impressions because the ravioli are delicious and the cod with chips was clearly frozen, dripping with fat and terribly over-salt, the waiting time for food was very long.
focaccia with three pastes and ravioli, spinach and ricotta + white wine was very tasty.
delicious ravioli.
very good pasta and ravioli only quite high prices ðŸ˜Œ
excellent place to taste the typical polish ravioli!. very modern and bright environment, the ravioli are handmade in the kitchen.
bao buns are great, bowls with rice are great.. but recently i had a chance to try a bowl with rice noodles in vietnamese sauce.

their buns are quite ok, but keep away from bowls, if you are into real asian rice bowls, not soups!!. the amount of â€˜bowl sauceâ€™ is just ridiculous, everything floats, or rather sinks like titanic under it
the meat bowl is a mistake - very salty chicken, red cabbage so salty that it is almost inedible.

noodle bowl is a joke, a mix of salads, a few slices of (good) beef, but nothing else, a sauce based on water and vinegar, which is not compatible with the rest of the salad, if i wanted to eat a salad, i would order a salad.
the burritos, chicken and beef bowl were really not good.

delicious shrimp bao rolls, and miso soup as well, while the sushi bowl is a slight misunderstanding that should not bear such a name, just a bowl of rice with lettuce and a few pieces of salmon, seasonal tea so sweet that you could not drink it
this place lacks a real mexican food, but the fact that you can eat for less than pln 30 - a grande burrito or all kinds of bowls is quite a decent portion of food
at some point, you are left with half a bowl of sterile pasta.
pepper-mushroom soup is great and delicious, but a bit drenched in hundreds of pepper balls in one bowl

burrito bowl okay, the meat was a little bit and that's what bothered me the most, the biggest problem was in the sauce (tomato) a lot of it everywhere and it only spoils the taste, my suggestion would be to add a cream-based sauce to the menu (i've already met one in mexican restaurants) then it would be fun and i could eat more often
delicious bowls!
interesting and tasty company dishes in bowls, unfortunately the mulled wine was cold.
it quickly became clear where such crowds came from :) everything we ate was delicious and carefully prepared, we especially liked the bowl with kimchi.
very nice and professional service, (which does not always go hand in hand), only completed the sensational experience provided by the feast of bowl kimchi flavors.
delicious kimchi bowl!
in my life i have never eaten seafood or beef worse.
pasta overcooked, chicken dry and not even like chicken, and so is beef.
hotel oki unfortunately a visit to a restaurant and ordering roast beef was a mistake the dish was presented nicely, unfortunately it was impossible to eat it.
delicious fish soup, beef brisket too intense in taste, as well as additives, so nothing fits together.
pork, beef, shrimp, fish and chicken were alll horrible.
steak tartare was okay, beef salad too sweet.
asian noodles with beef - pln 42, falafel burger pln 29 and cola pln 9
food - very tasty snacks fillo rolls and tzatziki, main course - beef kebap - ok, very salty skewers.
beef tartare ok, while boar bacon is average at most
we ordered beef serloin steak.
from everything ordered, only beef necks pleased.
we went for breakfasts (full english, beef bagel, pancakes).
beef cheeks melted in your mouth, great pork chop on the bone.
delicious fish soup with cod, juicy ribs, delicious strawberries in a roast beef and chocolate fondant.
first time to have beef cheeks, the meat was tasty tender and juicy!
rubbery seafood ...
cold, salty, dragged ... seafood is not their cup of tea.
i ordered a seafood dish, super salty.
dish: tagliatelle with seafood, delivery.
thai seafood soup is a joke - only 2 shrimps 2 mussels for 34 zl.
service and cocktails was really good, but seafood plato was to far away from our expectations.
covid protocols have transformed this beloved waterfront seafood and chowder house into a sub-par fast-food (slow-food) joint.
however, the seafood platter we ordered for the main course turned out to be very average.
only seafood dishes.
their kids menu was 90% seafood.
best seafood we have ever eaten !!!
the seafood risotto and spaghetti bolognese were really good.
we were on the road on i95 north and asked siri for a five star seafood restaurant near and we end up to fire & wine.
a great place with delicious, fresh seafood.
nice service, atmospheric place, 1st class drinks and seafood delicious!
there was nothing else in the falafel wrap, except dry lettuce, two slices of cucumber, and i found one red onion ring.. and uninteresting falafels.
the worst falafel kebab i've had in my life.. i don't know if the falafel was old, weathered, not thawed or what - at least it was inedible and i had to throw it away
cold kebab, vegetarian kebs, no meat alternative, no salads, no falafel !!!
the falafel kabab was uneatable with this sauce and went most of the trash.
the falafel was dry, the beer glass was stinking with a dirty cloth.

recently ordered drinking falafels and my favorite dish from this restaurant.. in the middle, almost all beetroot, some soy sauce, falafels (quite tasty) but this dish is not fresh anymore, it is dry.
available vegetarian options: veg-only, or falafel.

yesterday i got some falafel that's super spicy, they changed it, the new version was not grounded well at all, many pieces of whole chickpeas are inside, hard.. i usually love falafel, this time it's really an exception.
the fries are fried, the sauces are very medium, the falafel falls apart and is not very tasty (but the best of all).
falafel plate quite ok, but the eggplant with te avivu terrible, eggplant in a very sweet sauce, could not be eaten.
falafel was good but the place did the beers neat and horrible customer service
delicious falafels and power bowls.
the best falafels in the tri-city, good atmosphere, good people, every section of the card is full of surprises.
we also took 2 portions of falafels to go - exemplary.
as for the food itself, the falafel and hamburger was very good.
"ramen" was tasteless (both decoction and vegetables) was nothing like the picture.
unfortunately, the ramen was terrible, bittersweet, the nudle was one solid lump.
extremely greasy ramen soup which gave me food poisoning, and the worst tasting pad thai weâ€™ve ever had, sloppily presented with very few fresh ingredients.
they should cut off the chef's hands for spaghetti in ramen !!!
the same goes for ramen.
good beer, average ramen.
correct, but the ramen-typical additions were missing in both ramen.
very average ramen, not to say weak, too hot, cold, poor additions for this price, i do not recommend it.
to sum upâ€¦ ramen very average, fat with water, meat is a misunderstandingâ€¦.

if someone is looking for good old ramen here - unfortunately, he will not find it here.. ramen vol 2 is a misunderstanding.. vege ramen is much more varied, but don't be fooled, it also doesn't taste great.
i loved both the curry, and the ramen.
ramen is great, want to try other dishes!
burgers, waffles and ramen rock!
great ramen.
delicious vegan tartare and ramen.
bao rolls with pulled pork - very weak: the meat is cold, the rolls are usually steamed cooked.
we ordered a shrimp bowl and a set of bao scones.
far away from a real baoâ€¦ disappointed
i ordered a set of bao, asking to make it without sauce and onion due to a health condition.. we had to wait for the order for over half an hour and the bao were still served with sauce
when it comes to desserts, pingpong broke down a lot, once my favorite dessert was bao with ice cream, this time much worse, brilliant coconut ice cream replaced with mediocre vanilla ice cream.
i chose ðŸ‘‰ bao set #lunch set 2 x bao tofu / chicken / beef and fries / miso soup.. i had the bao tofu and chicken and miso soup.
bao buns came out especially fast, most likely skipping corners, the beef looked old and was cold

unfortunately, the shrimp bao was very average - 3 shrimps + rolls with mayonnaise salad poured over another portion of mayonnaise - shrimps must be eaten separately because otherwise it is impossible to eat them, so they are rolled with mayonnaise, there were 3 mini leaves of coriander, the taste was imperceptible.
great service, burger very weak, fish pesto ok, bao buns ... average.
we praised the large portion of tea very much :) bao buns are tasty but they fell apart very much, prices too high.
bao soft and delicious as well.

this place is at a great location the staff here are very nice and friendly.i am vegan so you have  food for everyone.i had the tofu bao set and my wife had the mango curry.plus we ordered for drinks and sweet potato fries.all of it was very good.the place has good atmosphere and they are very quick with the food.overall i would highly recommend this place.

delicious shrimp bao rolls, and miso soup as well, while the sushi bowl is a slight misunderstanding that should not bear such a name, just a bowl of rice with lettuce and a few pieces of salmon, seasonal tea so sweet that you could not drink it
bao is very light and tasty.
the bao rolls tasted the same a year ago and now and if i want them, i can be sure that i will get what i expect.. bao buns are, in my opinion, the best on the menu, especially those with prawns.

fewer employees (long waiting time for the waiter, drinks served almost at the same time as the food), poorer quality of ingredients (maybe only i came across such an "ugly" piece of chicken in a burger?). and definitely smaller portions (a burger much smaller, a dry roll ).

unfortunately, it is not the same aioli as it used to be, after my last visit to which i invited my daughters on the occasion of the children's day, i was very disappointed, the hamburger i received, despite the abundant interior, was packed in a cold roll, which spoiled the whole taste, and the apogee was serving coffee iced with whipped cream, which was fermented, sour and even sparkling.

really really really bad personel, bad atmosphere, very looooong time of waiting for everything, cold inside and the worst thing is that burger was expensive and also really bad - long story short everything here was bad and i don't recommend at all.
we ordered a burger, the meat stank and the taste was broken.
unfortunately the burgers are not as good as they look.
unfortunately, for the last few months the menu has been limited to items like .. um .. i would say bar-style .. burgers appeared, for example.
the burger is now with a sweet big bun, the filling itself is not enough.

i have always appreciated aioli, a very nice place with a kitchen that suits my taste, but after the last visit i was a bit disappointed when it comes to prices ... basic burger 37 zlotys, caesar salad with chicken 42 zlotys, freshly squeezed juice ... diluted with water, pilsner beer 17 zlotys.. as long as the price of the burger can be forgiven, because it was tasty and with additives, the price of the salad is a cosmos, a few leaves of lettuce and not all 100g of chicken for pln 42.

we were yesterday and we ordered 3 burgers which were average :( the sauce for the fries was delicious and the fries :) and as for burgers, there is a lot going on on the plate, but on average everything fits together e.g.
burger - average, mostly cold, other dishes have defended themselves.
everything on the menu is the same - supreme chicken, burgers and steaksâ€¦.
very good messi burger, smaller than picture though, good service, next time nornal burger
i came with my friends for a burger, they all had time to eat and i waited and waited (35 minutes).. the burger itself is great
we went for starters, burgers and pifka, which is great for me.
very good bbq burger and snacks.. there are fries with the burger and the whole burger with fries is a really huge portion.
pear and parsley soup was inedible, desserts that were once insane at this point are a failure.
desserts 2/5 drenched in juicy chocolate sauce and whipped cream - welcome to the 90s
awful dishes, no decent desserts and salty prices.
riverside dym i ogieÅ„ = really disappointed > desserts not worth eatingðŸ˜ž > but to be fair the place and personal was cosy and kind.
my mother and i went to the restaurant to taste coffee and dessert, we didn't try the dishes.

but we came back for dessert in the form of ice cream .. actually .. everything would be ok .. if not for the bill .. the menu shows an ice cream dessert in the amount of pln 12. however, there was 18 pln on the bill.

without the sauce the ribs are anything, then with my hands full of sauce for the ribs it lasted half an hour that they came to attend to me to order dessert (the only good thing about the place) they never gave me napkins.
tasty dessert, but inadequate in terms of size compared to the price.
i'd give a 4 as there is a very small selection of desserts and veggies but the prices are affordable and the service is always nice so a 5 is ok. good location.
plus a free dessert in compensation
it makes sense if someone wants to enjoy a starter, main course and dessert (all at a high level), otherwise there is a lot of hunger (the photo shows the main course - squid schnitzel).
brilliant food, from soup to dessert, all delicious.

i had the pleasure of tasting only the desserts because we came to the place to drink coffee and eat something sweet, but both the cake and the way of serving and the portion size at the highest level.. i highly recommend it to fans of rock music, but also to everyone else because i have never eaten a better dessert, and the other dishes also smelled and looked delicious.
amazing food, both drinks and desserts.
the waiter offered dessert as an apology.. a very large dessert!
tasteless sushi, the rolls were falling apart
tasteless chicken ramen, disappointing sushi.

i am very disappointed, i ordered sushi for delivery, the quality of the products is not the best or fresh, the tempura shrimp rolls were soaked, all the rolls were falling off dry reams and i had the impression that it was sour.. i do not recommend it, the worst sushi i have ever eaten ...
inept imitation of a "sushi restaurant"

as for sushi, even in supermarkets they can roll it up better, the whole set is packed in a small box, which made everything stick together and there was no option to take one piece out with chopsticks.. by far the worst sushi in tri-city.

delicious shrimp bao rolls, and miso soup as well, while the sushi bowl is a slight misunderstanding that should not bear such a name, just a bowl of rice with lettuce and a few pieces of salmon, seasonal tea so sweet that you could not drink it
i ordered several different sushi sets from mami sushi.. i have already ordered sushi restaurants in the tri-city and i rate the sets from mami sushi as average.
very little space to sit and talk freely over sushi ... a take-and-leave-style restaurant ... the food is average ... neither particularly exquisite nor in my mouth ... is it worth visiting?
i ordered the cauliflower and i had to eat it with sushi sticks because they never brought me silverware.
looks like a sushi place and some other spots will be added soon.
sushi very good, great prices.
another dish i love is sushi bowl - rice with fresh salmon, avocado, and salad.
good price, good sushi.. most people don't buy sushi every day and can't know everything.
wish i golfed here too but the sushi rolls at roys were top 3 all time.
roy's serves delicious sushi rolls.
fried eggs, unfortunately, the protein did not have enough time to cut the soy :) scrambled eggs half burnt, half not cut :( tea and coffee ok.
the scrambled eggs was overcooked and it seemes the chef must have been in a rush.

i'm sorry, but unfortunately the breakfast is very bad, we ordered scrambled eggs and asked for it to be more cut and we got completely liquid scrambled eggs.. the lady asked if everything tasted good, we said that unfortunately not because the scrambled eggs were not cut at all, the lady said that she gave the cook as much as the answer we received.
i reported it to the waiter and asked for scrambled eggs, which were served to me right on the table in a tiny ikea frying pan for children, no plate, no vegetables.
i haven't eaten such disgusting sausages and uncooked scrambled eggs for a long time ...
the only thing that did not suit me was the scrambled eggs that were too dry to a chip.
we ordered scrambled eggs with bacon and tomatoes, unfortunately we got scrambled eggs and bacon separately, tomatoes were a separate mini arugula salad.
i just had a simple breakfast: scrambled eggs with bread + butter.
the breakfast was just good (scrambled eggs and sausages), nothing special.

for scrambled eggs i got 3 slices of tomato and one cucumber.. if you fancy a breakfast such as scrambled eggs, frock coat, cottage cheese, that's ok. but if you want to eat something interesting, something other than the daily home menu, i advise against it.
delicious scrambled eggs with bacon and chives to which they give fresh, crispy bread.
delicious breakfasts, scrambled eggs, omelettes, pancakes, toasts, the choice is wide and everyone will like something
eggs benedict or scrambled eggs delicious fresh ... bread would change only to a thin toasted egg and in scrambled eggs should also be bagels, rolls or bread without gluten to choose.
the scrambled eggs were really good and i enjoyed the gnocchi :)
we had the scrambled eggs, waffle sandwich, eggs benedict and shashuka ( a little tangy for me) but good flavour.
the sour rye soup was supposed to be in bread but it wasn't, unacceptable, i won't even take it out, really terrible.
beetroot soup made of cardboard, taste at least strange.
fish soup very weak and tiny, and it cost pln 25: /
we haven't eaten such a bad soup for a long time :) literally diluted broth with a small amount of pasta, tasteless.
they force me the soup by force, the beetle in the soup
tomato cream soup - mixed soup, no revelation.
a very atmospheric place, unfortunately we got the sour rye soup in summer and when it comes to taste it is very average.
food very well presented, unfortunately wild boar ribs, sour rye soup and fondant very average, meringue on the other hand delicious.
we ordered onion soup and sour rye soup.
unfortunately, the sour rye soup does not impress.
very tasty soup, pizza a little bit plump but it's cool :)) friendly service
tasty food, delicious sour rye soup, very good cod.

very nice restaurant great decor, there is a kids' corner and food cossack tomato cream 10/10 will be eaten many times recommend prices git onion soup also extra and mushroom tagiatelle wonderful such a creamy mmhmm people go there
fish soup also very tasty, well seasoned.
the tomato cream soup i think was the best i have ever eaten, the pasta with prawns was also very delicious (very delicate prawns) we also ordered other dishes which were also mega.
food generally good, but we ordered hummus with vegetables which is terribly sour, the vegetables were underdone and generally nothing interesting, the asparagus is very tough, i guess underdone.
orange juice was ordered (it didn't even taste like an orange) -too much water in it; ((hummus also tasteless; (((.
lamb with hummus not good.

friendly service, food generally very good, except for the usual hummus, which is served with some main courses - very watery texture, poorly seasoned, it rarely happens that something really does not taste good to me and that was unfortunately such a situation :( i don't know if it was because of the consistency of the dish, or maybe for other reasons, i felt sick for a few hours after the meal
food generally good, but we ordered hummus with vegetables which is terribly sour, the vegetables were underdone and generally nothing interesting, the asparagus is very tough, i guess underdone.
a very tiny set of mezze, a micro portion of hummus, a handful of pickles, and some sauce.. the hummus itself was slightly bland, tahini hardly felt, there was no feeling of lemon.

the menu had zero vegan options- other than a large dollop of hummus and 2 stalks of celery and carrots... to top that exciting menu off, several children were running around like it was a playground.
hummus with vegetables for pln 25 is basically hummus with a symbolic vegetable decoration.
the hummus that was supposed to be a starter was brought along with the main course.
the eggplant hummus however was small and the presentation could be improved.
hummus rocks.
muze, hummus and kofta very tasty, well presented, very friendly service.
recommendable hummus, shakshuka and both types of breakfast - meat and vegetarian.
great hummus!
wonderful power bowls, hummuses, brownies ... :) i recommend it to everyone!
i tried the black spaghetti, gnocci, steak.

are food finally arrived in my father-in-law who had gotten the salmon had a fairly over cooked fish, i had gotten the scallop dish with three of the smallest scallops i have ever seen, my mother-in-law had the risotto which was very watery, and my husband had the pork and spaghetti dish which was very bland.
i ordered spaghetti bolognese - price inadequate to what i got: almost only pasta, traces of meat - definitely not recommended!
spaghetti with meatballs - "sauce" looked like someone just poured canned tomatoes over the pasta, the whole thing looked unappetizing.
when asked to give me the tastiest dish they have, i got something that resembled spaghetti, but the taste was extremely disgusting.
beef cheeks were well cooked, fried spaghetti is not to my taste.
the pasta was great, and three stars for the fact that i ordered spaghetti and i got tagliatelle like nothing, and it spoiled the whole effect
i took my friend here for a shared plate of anchovy spaghetti.. the spaghetti was thick and pasty and, although i expected a bit of salt from the anchovies, this w-a-y over the top.

my daughter really liked the ravioli,  but the rest of us weren't that impressed with the spaghetti,  fettuccine, or mostaccoili  it was fine italian food, but it wasn't anything we hadn't had before or made at home.
spaghetti with prawns in tomato sauce, sweet, not salty and not at all expressive.
very good shrimp spaghetti
the spaghetti tagliatelle with truffles and the caesar salad turned out to be delicious.
spaghetti with sirloin and molto delicioso porcini mushrooms
super tasty, and good spaghetti bolognese for the son
the seafood spaghetti was brilliant.
small dumplings, but the price for this number of pieces is also not great, so i have nothing to do with it.

the cream soup was quite good, while the russian dumplings tasted like water with dough and were overcooked and served only with cream.. i exchanged dumplings for a salad, serving chicken in this salad is just a joke, just like the ordered aperol, which we didn't get.
dumplings cold and dry, pasta cold and dry, brussels sprouts - lukewarm and overcooked, beans - cold and with a strange bitter aftertaste, ribs probably spoiled and of course - cold.
food lumpy, potato pancakes very good, dumplings sticking together badly, so there was a lot of water inside.
meat dumplings - very dry inside.
duck dumplings 3+ because they were cold.
pretty tasty dumplings.. unfortunately, the waiting time from the declared 15 minutes was 35. wonton soup inedible - such water after dumplings with 3 tablespoons of salt.
tripe and potato dumplings - both dishes were unfortunately average
i ate dumplings and pielmieni: delicious stuffing, but the doughs were thick and hard.

i am forced to change my opinion, after the last visit i was surprised by a different menu, the fact is that i haven't been there for a long time, but i remember the fried dumplings well.. currently, there are no fried dumplings on the menu.. the dumplings themselves tasty, but earlier it was better.
the gypsy pancake is a revelation, the goulash with potato dumplings is also very tasty.
delicious dumplings, it's a pity there is so little space inside.
the order arrived on time, the dumplings were delicious as usual, but i was not allowed to enjoy the full portion as it came mixed with a different type of dumplings.

very tasty dumplings, nice place, short waiting time, but a big minus for not informing about additional paid extras.. mrs. waitress offers, for example, cream, salads with dumplings - without informing that they are payable
delicious dumplings, worth recommending (we ordered 3 types), but i strongly advise against the sour rye soup: very salty, too thick, with overcooked potatoes inside.
nasty barmaid, sloppy coffee.
i do not recommend coffee.
hopeless coffee.
bad coffee.
nice place, very interesting decor, but unfortunately the coffee is bad.
coffee ok .. i have reservations about the amount of coffee in the mug ... not an adiculous amount for the price!
